  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A SPILL ON THE NIGHT SHIFT DURING SORT. RESPONDER IDENTIFIED PACAKAGE BY FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP. RESPONDER DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report X-2023060388
item.description:
Report X-2023060388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box containing a class 3 was found wish signs of a release at the INDH facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent found four glass bottles inside and two were broken. The bottles were packaged with fiberboard dividers and tap on the lids. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put onto conveyor belt already damaged. Upon receiving package it was removed from conveyor. DescribePack: Lid of bottles containing liquid was loose and led to a small amount of leakage into packaging and outer packaging surface. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: No leakage was occurring at time of package procurement, or any time after.

item.title: Report E-2023050689
item.description:
Report E-2023050689

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tanker was in in-transient storage when employee noticed a little material coming out of the knock off valve. When examined the knocked out valve the gasket was found to be bad (the valve has been overtightened). the gasket was changed and material was cleaned up in house and trailer was reinspected for no leaks before shipping. the Material also leaked because the trailer was in containment which is sloped with the back of the trailer lower than the front where the valve is located.

Report I-2023050124

item.title: Report X-2023051269
item.description:
Report X-2023051269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING IN AN INBOUND PRELOAD TRAILER UPON OPENING OF THE TRAILER. UNLOADER STOPPED THE BELT, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO CALLED FOR A HAZMAT RESPONDER. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH SPILL CART. DONNED PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE INCIDENT USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER THEN TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023051264
item.description:
Report X-2023051264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort a package was found to be leaking. Inside of the outer package was four inner packages each containing UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide Solution, 8. One of the inner packages developed a leak, but it is unclear what cause the leak. DG Admin was called and instructed the employee to place he package into a salvage drum, and to request an amended shippers dec from the shipper in order to continue the shipment.

item.title: Report X-2023051237
item.description:
Report X-2023051237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload. Package had not been loaded upright and was wet on top and one side. Package was placed in hazmat spill tote and removed from work area. Corrosive liquid made no contact with skin. Minor external leakage was cleaned up with spill absorbent powder. DescribePack: Upon inspection, 1 jug of corrosive liquid was found to have a loose cap and seal. This combined with improper loading caused contents to leak out and onto remaining 3 jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package immediately placed in hazmat spill tote and removed from work area. Minor spillage was cleaned up with spill absorbent powder.

item.title: Report X-2023051114
item.description:
Report X-2023051114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was brought to QA due to leaking substance. Upon further investigation it was noticed that that package had a puncture hole on the bottom of the container. DescribePack: body failed due to puncture. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once package was deemed a fully regulated hazmat it was segregated from the other packages

item.title: Report E-2023050605

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING OF AN AIR PACKAGE, AEROSOL RATTLE SOUNDS WERE HEARD COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE TO FIND TWO 12 OUNCE HARVEST RED AEROSOL CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING AEROSOLS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023050777
item.description:
Report X-2023050777

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At some point during transit, caps on bottles became loose and liquid spilled out of bottles and soaked through box. Although box was wet and damaged, no other packages appeared to have been damaged as a result of the leak. Package was caught in the unload and taken to damages to be processed. DescribePack: Caps on the bottles were loose. After discovery of the leak, caps were retightened. Solution dried on the bottles in the package and caused the box to be wet with the solution. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a damage tote and sent to damage area upon discovery in the unload.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER ALERTED ME TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN UNLOAD. UPON INSPECTION, THE PACKAGE CONTAINED FOUR GALLONS OF CLEANING SOLUTION, I PLACED IT IN A TOTE LINED WITH A PLASTIC BAG AND BEGAN THE DAMAGED HAZMAT PROCESS. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE OF THE SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING ABOUT HALF A CUP OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIC LINED TOTE AND REMOVED FROM THE AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023050170
item.description:
Report E-2023050170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 3rd, 2023 at 1931 personnel in the CSXT Howell Yard discovered NATX38424, a loaded tank car of Acetone leaking from the protective housing. The car was isolated the shipper was notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023-05-03-00321). Marion environmental Inc., a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a steady drip coming from the protective housing, upon further inspection it was determined the liquid line valve was not in the closed position and the secondary securement plug had no thread sealant allowing product to pass through the valve. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative- Ara Rainey, ara.rainey@sabic.com, 812-833-1558. Contractor personnel closed the valve, applied thread tape to, and properly secured, the secondary closure plug. and applied thread tape to the secondary securement plug.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on vans second shelf on its side leaking out. Safety precautions were taken when removing package and spill with gloves and absorbent towels. Package was removed from vehicle placed in hazardous bin. Found at 330pm when van arrived back to station. DescribePack: On its side. Loose lids. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from vehicle placed in hazardous bin. Spill was cleaned up with paper towels and absorbent towels while wearing gloves. Damaged items and clean up were placed in hazardous bag and in put into bin.
